p: Since its establishment in 1948, the WHO has pioneered the development of surveillance networks for the monitoring and control of emerging and re-emerging infectious diseases. These networks involve programs initiated by the WHO as well as alliances with independent programs, such as the Global Influenza Surveillance and Response System (GISRS, https://www.who.int/influenza/gisrs_laboratory/en/) and the Global Infection Prevention and Control Network (GIPCN, https://www.who.int/csr/bioriskreduction/laboratorynetwork/gipc_next_steps/en/).
